required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Lake Washington Vascular VenaSeal™ Post-Market Evaluation (WAVES)
clinical_study.official_title: Lake Washington Vascular VenaSeal™ Post-Market Evaluation: WAVES

brief_summary.textblock: The VenaSeal Closure system offers an outpatient treatment option for the permanent closure of lower extremity superficial truncal veins, such as the great saphenous vein (GSV), through endovascular embolization with coaptation. VenaSeal is intended for use in adults with clinically symptomatic venous reflux as diagnosed by duplex ultrasound (DUS).

primary_outcome.measure: Complete closure (CC) of the PTVS as assessed by duplex ultrasound 1 month after the index procedure.
primary_outcome.description: CC of the PTVS as assessed by duplex ultrasound 1 month after the index procedure.

secondary_outcome.measure: CC of the PTVS, as assessed by duplex ultrasound
CC of Treated Vein Segments (TVS), expressed on a per-segment basis, as assessed by duplex ultrasound
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month and 3 months after the index procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life as measured by the venous clinical severity scores (rVCSS)
Quality of life as measured by the Aberdeen Varicose Vein Questionnaire (AVVQ)
Quality of life as measured by the EQ-5D
Return to normal activities and return to work; day of procedure is day 0

secondary_outcome.description: Measured in case report form (yes or no, and if yes, the Investigator will specify what the adjunctive measure is).

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and adverse event for below the knee greater saphenous vein treatment
Safety and adverse events for large diameter TVS defined as veins larger than 8 mm in diameter

secondary_outcome.description: At selected visits, the subject will complete a brief questionnaire rating satisfaction with treatment provided and whether the subject would undergo the treatment again.

secondary_outcome.measure: CC of TVS, expressed on a per-segment basis

intervention.description: A medical device kit consisting of seven delivery tools and the proprietary VenaSeal™ Adhesive (Medtronic Cardiovascular, Santa Rosa, CA). The device is used to treat venous reflux in lower extremity superficial truncal veins for subjects in the treatment arm..
